result.execSummary:
The defendant DeAnn Louise Glewwe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: EACH COUNT CONCURRENT

miscConds.notes: Comply with any conditions imposed by the probation agent.

records.addlTxt: from S/W DOC re: letter sent requesting clarification of DNA surcharge was sent in error.

from S/W DOC requesting clarification of DNA surcharges. Wis. Stats. 973.046(1r) provides if the Court imposes a sentence or places a person on probation on or after January 1, 2014, the court shall impose a DNA surcharge

3:20 Defendant DeAnn Louise Glewwe in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie files an amended information. Def will plea guilty to charges in the amended information. probation: court costs. Helgeson and Def agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to charges contained in an amended information; Helgeson stipulates to a factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of charges contained in amended information. Thorie and Helgeson address sentencing. Court: S/W 2 years concurrent. conditions: court costs and any conditions set forth by agents.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea hearing on October 6, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
